Package frogger_main

Class ScoreHandler

java.lang.Object
frogger_main.ScoreHandler
public class ScoreHandler
extends java.lang.Object
This class handles writing and reading the player score to and from a list

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    java.io.File file  
    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> names  
    java.util.ArrayList<Score> scores  

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    ScoreHandler()
    The constructor checks for the text file , and creates one if it doesn't exist, it also calls the readscores function to initialize the scoreboard

    This function reads the score data from the text file and stores it in an array

  • Constructor Details

    • ScoreHandler

      public ScoreHandler()
      The constructor checks for the text file , and creates one if it doesn't exist, it also calls the readscores function to initialize the scoreboard

  • Method Details

    • writescores

      public void writescores​(java.lang.String name, int score, int level)
      This function writes new data into the file, it works by first adding the new score to the scores list. and then writing all entities of the list to the file in the correct format
      Parameters:
      name - the name the player wants to use
      score - the score the player has accumulated
      level - the level the player has reached

    • readscores

      public void readscores()
      This function reads the score data from the text file and stores it in an array

    • getscore

      public java.util.ArrayList<Score> getscore()
      A public method to get the scores
      Returns:
      an array containing the player scores

    • gethighscore

      public int gethighscore()
      A function that gets the highscore
      Returns:
      the highest score

    • getPoints

      public int getPoints()
      Method to return player points
      Returns:
